ngiemboon: Fùɔ Ndavîd la gwɔ́ tà ńcʉ́ʼʉ ńgee pɔ́ ńkwé, ńná mentÿɔgɔ́ né míŋ we fùɔ Salémo ngie:
en: As the time approached for David to die,   he ordered his son Solomon,

ngiemboon: «N gee páʼɔɔn n ge gʉa páʼ wɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ gẅiin légʉa púʼu. Shÿɔgɔ, ńgwɔ́ mámbàŋa.
en: “As for me, I am going the way of all of the earth.   Be strong and be a man,  # 2:2 Jos 1:6–7,9; 1Sm 4:9

ngiemboon: Ńkúʼte membʉ̌ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé jù, ńgiŋe na memánzsè mé, ńne ńtÿɔ́gɔ kwò na mentÿɔgɔ́ mé lâ membʉ̌ mé, ńgiŋ páʼ à la záb, ńcʉa na mmó gie mé la ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne membʉ̌ Mǒonsê, à cʉa púʼu, á kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ gie ɔ̀ ge gÿo, mbɔɔ nzɔ̌ jʉʼ gie ɔ̀ ge kwaŋte légʉa wó wɔ́ɔ, à pumte pumte.
en: and keep your obligation to the Lord your God to walk in his ways and to keep his statutes, commands, ordinances, and decrees. This is written in the law of Moses, so that you will have success in everything you do   and wherever you turn,

ngiemboon: À cʉa púʼu, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gÿo mmó gie à la kaʼ ńtí wɔ́ɔn ńgɔɔn ngie: “Egubé jú lɔɔn ńtÿɔ́gɔ kwò yɔ́b ńdiŋe, ńgẅiin pyennɛ́ nzèm mèŋ, né ngwòŋ ntʉ́m wɔ́b ntsèm, mbɔɔ né wɔb legwɔ́ ntsèm, mbà n těen ńdáʼa ńzága nyìŋ gẅie à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ á jÿó ndá jù, ńnéŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ Ésàlayɛ wɔ́.”
en: and so that the Lord will fulfill his promise that he made to me: ‘If your sons take care to walk faithfully before me with all their heart and all their soul,   you will never fail to have a man on the throne of Israel.’  # 2:4 2Sm 7:12–13; 1Kg 8:25; 9:5

ngiemboon: Fùɔ Ndavîd gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie, ɔ̀ ne ńcwoŋo ńzsé nò tepòŋ ntsèm gie Jÿohab gẅie aa míŋ Tseluya wembàŋa ka gÿo na mèŋ. Yé zɔ ka zẅé Abnɛɛ gẅie aa míŋ Nɛ̂ɛ wembàŋa ńgÿo Amasa gẅie aa míŋ Yetɛ̂ɛ wembàŋa, pie é laa metándá palÿɔ́ʼncù mépʉ́a. À ka zẅé wɔ́b púʼu, ńdɔg ncù ḿpfɛte metse mɔ́b fʉ̀ʼʉ mbʉ́lè, ńgÿo púʼu, ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ kwaʼ ngàŋmefʉa.
en: “You also know what Joab son of Zeruiah did to me   and what he did to the two commanders of Israel’s army, Abner son of Ner  # 2:5 2Sm 3:27 and Amasa son of Jether.  # 2:5 2Sm 20:10 He murdered them in a time of peace to avenge blood shed in war. He spilled that blood on his own waistband and on the sandals of his feet.  # 2:5 LXX, Old Lat read on my waistband and . . . my feet; v. 31

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ tá ɔ̀ ge lɔgɔ zsénò, é gÿo, tà ɔ́ le nyé yé á pʉ́le ńzẅiŋ, tá ńkwé wɔ́.
en: Act according to your wisdom, and do not let his gray head descend to Sheol in peace.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ge gÿo lɔgɔ pyennɛ́ líe gubé Mbazilayi gẅie aa nyìŋ Ngalad, pɔ́ ge gÿo gwɔ́ na nùɔ pʉ̀a pie é pfɛ́ɛ mmó á tápèle gù lyɛ̌ʼ ntsèm, ńtí nue á laa fʉ̀ʼ gie n da ne ńkÿo fɛ̌ gù Absalom, pɔ́ kẅéte wɔ́ɔn.
en: “Show kindness to the sons of Barzillai the Gileadite and let them be among those who eat at your table   because they supported me when I fled from your brother Absalom.  # 2:7 2Sm 19:31–39

ngiemboon: Táʼ, te ké ńdege Shʉmeyi gẅie aa míŋ Ngelaa wembàŋa, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ láʼa Mbahulim, á gie aa tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Mbɛŋjÿamɛŋ: Shʉmeyi ŋwɛ́ la gɔɔn menò ntʉtʉ na mèŋ á lyɛ̌ʼ gie n dɔ̌ɔn ńkÿo ńgee né Mahanayîm. Táʼ, n da gwɔ́ tà ne ḿbiŋe nzèm, á cwóŋ ńzáʼa wɔ́ɔn ngʉ̀ŋe ntse Juundʉŋ, á cʉa púʼu, n dɔg lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ńkʉa mbwó yé ngie ngwɔ́ ń de lɔg nně ncù ńzẅé yé wɔ́.
en: “Keep an eye on Shimei son of Gera, the Benjaminite from Bahurim who is with you. He uttered malicious curses against me the day I went to Mahanaim.   But he came down to meet me at the Jordan River, and I swore to him by the Lord, ‘I will never kill you with the sword.’  # 2:8 2Sm 19:16–23

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ńké ńgʉa na fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, mbà gù gẅie ɔɔ nzsènò, ɔ̀ te nyé té néŋ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ twó yé wɔ́, ɔ̀ ge zsé páʼ ɔ̀ ge gÿo na yé púʼu: Tà mbɔɔ páʼ à zẅǐŋ tɛʼ, ɔ̀ ge gÿo à kwé.»
en: So don’t let him go unpunished, for you are a wise man. You know how to deal with him to bring his gray head down to Sheol with blood.”

ngiemboon: Fùɔ Ndavîd la gwɔ́ tà ńkwé, mé túŋo yé Yelúzálèm, á jʉʼ gie mé tóŋ lê tÿǒsoŋ fùɔ Ndavîd.
en: Then David rested with his ancestors   and was buried in the city of David.  # 2:10 2Sm 5:7

ngiemboon: Fùɔ Ndavîd la sáʼ pa Ésàlayɛ na ngùʼu láʼ móm lekùɔ: Ńdɔgɔ púʼu ésáʼa láʼa Embeloŋ ngùʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a, ḿbiŋ sáʼa Yelúzálèm ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b tá lé móm tá.
en: The length of time David reigned over Israel was forty years: he reigned seven years in Hebron and thirty-three years in Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Fùɔ Salémo la néŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ tá we fùɔ Ndavîd púʼu, lefùɔ sé vfóte.
en: Solomon sat on the throne of his father David, and his kingship was firmly established.

ngiemboon: Á láʼ ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, Andoniya gẅie aa míŋ Angid wembàŋa tó ńgyá Mbɛdshÿébà gẅie aa má pà Salémo. Mbɛdshÿébà ŋwɛ́ zɛ́te yé ngie: «Ɔ̀ lɔgɔ mbʉ́lè ńtóo keen?» Mbɛdshÿébà tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Oon!»
en: Now Adonijah son of Haggith   came to Bathsheba, Solomon’s mother. She asked, “Do you come peacefully? ”

ngiemboon: Á gíŋ ńgɔɔn ngie: «N gẅiin tàʼa nò gie n ge gɔɔn mbwó gù.» Á tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Gɔɔn!»
en: and then asked, “May I talk with you? ”

ngiemboon: Andoniya gɔɔn ngie: «Ɔ̀ ne ńzsé páʼ lefùɔ la zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ sɔ́ɔn, tà pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ntsèm pú ne ńtÿɔ́gɔ menÿɔ́g mɔ́b pɔ́ na mèŋ páʼ n ge cʉ́ʼʉ fùɔ wɔb. Táʼ, lefùɔ gÿo ńcʉ́ʼ ńtó ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ se fɛ̌ wɔ̀ɔn, mélàʼmie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ la záb légwɔ́ gie à ge gwɔ́ fùɔ.
en: “You know the kingship was mine,”   he said. “All Israel expected me to be king, but then the kingship was turned over to my brother,  # 2:15 1Kg 1:38–46 for the Lord gave it to him.  # 2:15 1Ch 23:9–10; 28:5,7; Dn 2:21; 4:17; Jn 19:11; Rm 13:1

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, n gẅiin tàʼa mmó gẅie n ge lúɔ mbwó gù. N dɔɔn ńdúɔ, ɔ̀ pɔ́ɔn lélʉʼ!» Mbadshÿémbà tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Gɔɔn!»
en: So now I have just one request of you; don’t turn me down.”

ngiemboon: Andoniya gɔɔn ngie: «Mèŋ sẅíŋte gú ngie ɔ̀ gʉa ńgyá fùɔ Salémo, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie á náa Ambishÿag gẅie aa múɔ Shunam n dɔgɔ yé ńgÿo nzwě wɔ̀ɔn, á nue n zsé ngie ngwɔ́ á le lʉʼʉ nò mbwó gù wɔ́.»
en: He replied, “Please speak to King Solomon since he won’t turn you down. Let him give me Abishag the Shunammite   as a wife.”

ngiemboon: Mbɛdshÿébà tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Áa mbòŋ! Kwàʼ mèŋ máŋwɛ́ ge lɔg lezíŋ shú gɔɔn nò mbwó fùɔ.»
en: “Very well,” Bathsheba replied. “I will speak to the king for you.”

ngiemboon: Mbɛdshÿébà gʉa ńgyá fùɔ Salémo ńtí Andoniya. Afùɔ lu ssé na lʉŋe lefùɔ yé, ńgʉa ńzáʼa má we, ńtyé mvfò yé, ńŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ tà zǐ yé kíbe ssé, ḿbiŋ ńnéŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ yé, ńtsẅi mé tÿɔ́gɔ lʉŋe máfùɔ na gwoŋó pwó yé yetʉ̀, á néŋe mǒ.
en: So Bathsheba went to King Solomon to speak to him about Adonijah. The king stood up to greet her, bowed to her, sat down on his throne, and had a throne placed for the king’s mother.   So she sat down at his right hand.  # 2:19 Ps 110:1; Mt 20:21

ngiemboon: Á leen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwó yé ngie: «N gẅiin pɔ́ múɔ mémmó gẅie n ge lúɔ mbwó gù. N dɔɔn ńdúɔ, ɔ̀ pɔ́ɔn lélʉʼ.» Afùɔ gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Má wɔ̀ɔn, zɛ́te mmó gie ɔ̀ kwǒŋ, n te lʉʼ wɔ́.»
en: Then she said, “I have just one small request of you. Don’t turn me down.”

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te ngie: «À lɔɔn ngwɔ́ mé le náa Ambishÿag gẅie aa múɔ Shunam né fɛ̌ gù Andoniya, á lɔgɔ yé ńgÿo nzwě we wɔ́ ka?»
en: So she said, “Let Abishag the Shunammite be given to your brother Adonijah as a wife.”

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Salémo tsɔ́ʼ né má we ngie: «Ńtí kɔ́, ɔ̀ zɛ́te pɔ́ ndàʼ nò Ambishÿag gẅie aa múɔ Shunam, lénáa mbwó Andoniya? Zɛ́te mbɔɔ páʼ yé zɔ ge cʉ́ʼ gwɔ́ fùɔ, ńtí nue, aa ndyè wɔ̀ɔn! Zɛ́te lefùɔ ńná né yé, zɛ́te ńná né Ambiyataa gẅie aa nùŋepwɔʼ, zɛ́te ńná mbɔɔ né Jÿohab gẅie aa míŋ Tseluya wembàŋa!»
en: King Solomon answered his mother, “Why are you requesting Abishag the Shunammite for Adonijah? Since he is my elder brother,   you might as well ask the kingship for him,  # 2:22 2Sm 16:20–22 for the priest Abiathar, and for Joab son of Zeruiah.”  # 2:22 LXX, Vg, Syr read kingship for him, and on his side are Abiathar the priest and Joab son of Zeruiah,# 2:22 1Kg 1:7

ngiemboon: Á cʉa púʼu, fùɔ Salémo lɔg lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ńkʉa ńgɔɔn ngie: «Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie e Ssé gÿo n gyá ngɔ́ʼ, páʼ n dɔɔn te zẅé Andoniya ńtí mmó gie à zɛ́te lɔɔn wɔ́,
en: Then King Solomon took an oath by the Lord: “May God punish me and do so severely   if Adonijah has not made this request at the cost of his life.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, n tyě páʼɔɔn á mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie aa ntʉ̀ntʉ̀, á yé gẅie à la tóonte wɔ́ɔn, ḿbiŋ ńnéŋe wɔ́ɔn na lʉŋe lefùɔ Ndavîd gẅie aa tá wɔ̀ɔn, mbà à la piŋ ńkaʼ ngie lefùɔ é ge láʼ gwɔ́ sɔ́ɔn lâ se ngẅɛ̀ ndá yɔ̀ɔn. Páʼ á gwɔ́ pɛ́ʼɛ̀ la, Andoniya ge nuŋe ssé lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn é cʉ́ʼʉ mpfó.»
en: And now, as the Lord lives #— #the one who established me, seated me on the throne of my father David, and made me a dynasty as he promised    #— #I swear Adonijah will be put to death today! ”

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn púʼu, ńdeen ńké ńtúmo Mbenaya gẅie aa míŋ Yoyanda, á gʉa ńzẅé yé; wɔɔn aa páʼ Andoniya la kwé púʼu.
en: Then King Solomon dispatched Benaiah son of Jehoiada,   who struck down Adonijah, and he died.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ pɔ́ɔnte ńgɔɔn né Ambiyataa gẅie aa nùŋepwɔʼ ngie: «Fó jʉʼɔɔn ńgʉa né Anatɔd, gʉa ńnéŋe na metsetsáʼ mú, ńtí nue ɔɔ nyìŋ gẅie ngwɔ́ mé zẅé yé zẅé, táʼ, ngwɔ́ ń de gÿo ɔ̀ kwé lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn wɔ́, ńtí nue á laa fʉ̀ʼ gie fùɔ Ndavîd gẅie aa tá wɔ̀ɔn la nyé ńgwɔ́ wó, ɔ̀ kaa kʉbé kʉ̀a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo páʼ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie tá wɔ̀ɔn la gyá ngɔ́ʼ lêkɔ́ wɔ́ɔ, mbà pi yé zɔ lɔ̌ɔn ńgyá.»
en: The king said to the priest Abiathar,   “Go to your fields in Anathoth.  # 2:26 Jos 21:18; Jr 1:1 Even though you deserve to die, I will not put you to death today, since you carried the ark of the Lord God in the presence of my father David  # 2:26 2Sm 15:24–25,29 and you suffered through all that my father suffered.”  # 2:26 1Sm 22:20–23; 2Sm 19:11

ngiemboon: Salémo la gɔɔn púʼu, ńdeen ńké fó na fàʼa nùŋepwɔʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńjwoŋo Ambiyataa. À la gÿo púʼu, tá nò gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la kaʼ ńtí tsìŋendá Elîɛ, á tÿǒsoŋo Shʉlo, á lɔg ḿbumte.
en: So Solomon banished Abiathar from being the Lord’s priest, and it fulfilled the Lord’s prophecy he had spoken at Shiloh against Eli’s family.

ngiemboon: Jÿohab la gwɔ́ tà ńjúʼu nò gie á ka gÿo Andoniya pɔ́ Ambiyataa, ńgwóon ńkÿo ńgʉa né tsɛ̀ɛ ntàb Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńdyeen ngʉ̀ŋe jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ. Jÿohab la te cʉ́me nzèm Absalom wɔ́, à la cʉ́m pɔ́ nzèm Andoniya.
en: The news reached Joab. Since he had supported Adonijah   but not Absalom,  # 2:28 2Sm 18:1–5 Joab fled to the Lord’s tabernacle and took hold of the horns of the altar.  # 2:28 Ex 21:12–14; 1Kg 1:50

ngiemboon: Mé la gʉa éshwóŋo fùɔ Salémo ngie Jÿohab kÿǒ ńgʉa ńdyeen tsɛ̀ɛ ntàb Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, á ngʉ̀ŋe jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ. Salémo leen ńké ńtúmo Mbenaya gẅie aa míŋ Yoyanda, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Gʉa ńzẅé yé!»
en: It was reported to King Solomon, “Joab has fled to the Lord’s tabernacle and is now beside the altar.”

ngiemboon: Mbenaya la gʉa tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ ntàb Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńgɔɔn né Jÿohab ngie: «Fó jʉʼɛ ńkẅɛ! Afùɔ zɔ tsẅǐi.» Táʼ, á tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Ngǎŋ, n ge kwé pɔ́ jʉʼɔɔn!» Mbenaya piŋ nzèm éshwóŋo fùɔ ngie: Júʼ páʼ n gɔ̌ɔn né Jÿohab, á tsɔ́ʼ púʼu.
en: So Benaiah went to the tabernacle and said to Joab, “This is what the king says: ‘Come out! ’ ”

ngiemboon: Afùɔ gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Gÿo páʼ à gɔ̌ɔn, zẅé yé, ńtúŋo yé. Ɔ̀ ge gÿo púʼu, é lɔg fó na metse mie Jÿohab la pfɛte té ntoŋ, é peʼe wɔ́ɔn mbɔɔ tsìŋendá yɔ́ɔn
en: The king said to him, “Do just as he says. Strike him down and bury him in order to remove from me and from my father’s family the blood that Joab shed without just cause.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge gÿo gÿo metse mé sele ésẅɛ́ʼɛ twó yé, mélàʼmie à ka gÿo mé zẅé mbàŋa yépʉ́a gie é laa ngàŋa nò nénʉ́, ḿbiŋ ńgẅiin tsẅé mbòŋo tà ńcʉa yé: Wɔɔn aa Abnɛɛ gẅie aa míŋ Nɛ̂ɛ wembàŋa, ńgwɔ́ tándá palÿɔ́ʼncù á tsɛ̀ɛ láʼa Ésàlayɛ, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Amasa gẅie aa míŋ Yetɛ̂ɛ wembàŋa, ńgwɔ́ tándá palÿɔ́ʼncù á tsɛ̀ɛ láʼa Yúndà. À la lɔg nně ncù ńzẅéte wɔ́b tà fùɔ Ndavîd gẅie aa tá wɔ̀ɔn te zsé
en: The Lord will bring back his own blood on his head because he struck down two men more righteous and better than he, without my father David’s knowledge. With his sword, Joab murdered Abner   son of Ner, commander of Israel’s army, and Amasa  # 2:32 2Sm 20:8–10 son of Jether, commander of Judah’s army.

ngiemboon: Metse mɔ́b ge láʼ kwɔ́ʼɔ twó Jÿohab pâ ngẅɛ̀ ndá yé, pɔ́ ndàʼndàʼ. Táʼ, ńké ńgʉa na Ndavîd pâ ngẅɛ̀ ndá ye, mbà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge láʼ néŋ mbʉ́lè temì á na Ndavîd, á na ngẅɛ̀ ye, mbɔɔ na mefùɔ pie é ge láʼ néŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ yé.
en: The responsibility for their deaths will come back to Joab and to his descendants   forever, but for David, his descendants, his dynasty, and his throne, there will be peace from the Lord forever.”  # 2:33 2Sm 3:28–29

ngiemboon: Mbenaya gẅie aa míŋ Yoyanda wembàŋa la pʉ ńgʉa ńzẅé Jÿohab, ńgÿo mé túŋo yé mbʉ̀a yé, á kwòŋotsẅɛ.
en: Benaiah son of Jehoiada   went up, struck down Joab, and put him to death. He was buried at his house in the wilderness.  # 2:34 2Sm 2:32

ngiemboon: Á cʉa púʼu, Afùɔ leen ńké ńdɔgɔ Mbenaya gẅie aa míŋ Yoyanda wembàŋa ńkúbe Jÿohab, ńgÿo á cʉ́ʼʉ tándá palÿɔ́ʼncù, ńdɔgɔ Sandɔg gẅie aa nùŋepwɔʼ ńkúbe twó Ambiyataa.
en: Then the king appointed Benaiah son of Jehoiada in Joab’s place over the army,   and he appointed the priest Zadok in Abiathar’s place.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Salémo la túm mé tóŋo Shʉmeyi ńná né yé, á gɔɔn né yé ngie: Kwɛ́ ndá jú á Yelúzálèm, ńtsẅé wó, ńtí nue n te ne ńkwoŋo ngie ɔ̀ fó tÿǒsoŋ ńkẅɛ wɔ́.
en: Then the king summoned Shimei   and said to him, “Build a house for yourself in Jerusalem and live there, but don’t leave there and go anywhere else.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ piŋ ńzsé ngie ɔ̀ ge láʼ túmo fúʼu Sendeloŋ síŋe wɔ́ɔ, é kwé, metse mú piŋ sele ńkwɔ́ʼɔ twó gù.»
en: On the day you do leave and cross the Kidron Valley,   know for sure that you will certainly die. Your blood will be on your own head.”  # 2:37 Gn 2:17; 2Sm 1:16

ngiemboon: Shʉmeyi tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó fùɔ ngie: «Áa mbòŋ! Mbà nkwɔbɔ́, n ge gÿo mmó gie ɔ̀ gɔ̌ɔn» Shʉmeyi la néŋe Yelúzálèm tɛʼ.
en: Shimei said to the king, “The sentence is fair; your servant will do as my lord the king has spoken.” And Shimei lived in Jerusalem for a long time.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, é gwaa cʉa mmó ngùʼ tá menkwɔɔn Shʉmeyi mépʉ́a kÿo, ńgʉa ńkẅɛ́te Akísè gẅie aa míŋ Maaka wembàŋa, gẅie à laa fùɔ láʼa Ngâd. Shʉmeyi la gwɔ́ tà ńjúʼ ngie menkwɔɔn pé kéen ńkÿo ńgʉa né Ngâd,
en: But then, at the end of three years, two of Shimei’s slaves ran away to Achish   son of Maacah, king of Gath.  # 2:39 Jos 13:3; 1Sm 6:16–17; 21:10 Shimei was informed, “Look, your slaves are in Gath.”

ngiemboon: Shʉmeyi lu ssé, ńtáŋte nzìkáasè ye ńkwɔ́ʼ ńnéŋe mǒ ńgʉa lé Ngâd, á mbʉ̀a Akísè, léfaʼ menkwɔɔn pé, ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ḿbíŋ né Yelúzálèm.
en: So Shimei saddled his donkey and set out to Achish at Gath to search for his slaves. He went and brought them back from Gath.

ngiemboon: Mé gʉa shwóŋo Salémo ngie Shʉmeyi ně fó Yelúzálèm ńgʉa Ngâd tá ḿbiŋ nzèm.
en: It was reported to Solomon that Shimei had gone from Jerusalem to Gath and had returned.

ngiemboon: Ńtúm mé gʉa ńtóŋo yé á tó, afùɔ gɔɔn né yé ngie: «N da gÿo ɔ̀ lɔg lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ńkʉa ngie ɔ̀ těen ńdáʼa éfóo tÿǒsoŋ ńkẅɛɛ wɔ́, n da tʉ́ njÿó shwóŋo gú ngie alyɛ̌ʼ gie ɔ̀ ge láʼ kẅɛ, ɔ̀ ge kwé. N da gɔɔn púʼu, ɔ̀ te tsɔ́ʼ ngie: Áa mbòŋ! Ɔ̀ jǔʼ wɔ́ le!»
en: So the king summoned Shimei and said to him, “Didn’t I make you swear by the Lord and warn you, saying, ‘On the day you leave and go anywhere else, know for sure that you will certainly die’? And you said to me, ‘The sentence is fair; I will obey.’

ngiemboon: Ńtí kɔ́ ɔ̀ ka te tÿɔ́gɔ kwò na mmó gie ɔ̀ la kʉ̀a mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ḿbiŋ ńgiŋ páʼ mentÿɔgɔ́ mie n da ná né gù, é ne ńzɛ́te wɔ́ɔ?
en: So why have you not kept the Lord’s oath and the command that I gave you? ”

ngiemboon: Afùɔ leen ńké gɔɔn né Shʉmeyi ngie: «Ɔ̀ cwoŋo ńne ńzsé menò tepòŋ ntsèm mie ɔ̀ la fʉʼʉ na fùɔ Ndavîd gẅie à laa tá wɔ̀ɔn, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge gÿo, mɛ̌ menò tepòŋ ŋwɛ́ sele ésẅɛ́ʼɛ twó gù.
en: The king also said, “You yourself know all the evil that you did to my father David.   Therefore, the Lord has brought back your evil on your head,

ngiemboon: Táʼ, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge gÿo néŋ mbʉ́lè na mèŋ, é piŋ gÿo lefùɔ tsìŋendá Ndavîd, e láʼa ńtsẅé ḿvfote vfoté.»
en: but King Solomon will be blessed, and David’s throne will remain established before the Lord forever.”

ngiemboon: Afùɔ la tsẅi Mbenaya gẅie aa míŋ Yoyanda wembàŋa, gʉa ńzẅé Shʉmeyi. Wɔɔn aa páʼ à la kwé púʼu; fùɔ Salémo la gÿo púʼu, ńdɔg ńgÿo lefùɔ sé kẅíʼi ḿvfóte.
en: Then the king commanded Benaiah son of Jehoiada, and he went out and struck Shimei down, and he died. So the kingdom was established in Solomon’s hand.
